column4: hmm, my swap doesnt seem to be "mounting" on boot. Where should i start looking?
just says: # swap was on /dev/sda5 during installation
now try 'sudo fdisk -l'  and blkid command to be sure the uuid's are correct
the disk identifier's listed there are much much shorter than that UID
have you resized the disks recently? that can change the uuid's
you could edit the fstab to use the /dev/sdXX type name also.
anyway for me to activate it without rebooting? I found something like swapon -a, but that gave me the following error: ubuntu:/$ sudo swapon -a
sda5 is your swap partition? could be it got messed up
swapon is ran at boot time.. so the result is the same.. thats proberly why its failing in the first place
yes. So now do i unmess it up? =P
reforamt the swap partition  with mkswap /dev/sda5 (IF sda5 is the swap)
you can remove/purge them afterwards and it should get rid of the configs.
i recall ubuntu-tweak having a  thing for that also.
its in the users home dir. I forget where exactly.
like i said, i figured it out. Thanks though
